intro: Japarandiba dubia, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and urban landscapes.
